comment.author: 45586426@N06
comment._content: Color image of Douglas A-1H Skyraider Bu No 139609 in Light Gull Gray and Insignia White. VA-176 ‘Thunderbolts’ Modex 408 tail code AK of 6th Fleet Carrier Air Wing Ten CVW-10 Decorative red fuselage flash akin to the squadron name. Red E for squadron excellence painted above ‘NAVY’. The above picture may also be viewed here: commons.wikimedia.org/wiki/File:A-1H_Skyraider_VA-176_196... Douglas A-1H Skyraider (BuNo 139609) of VA-176 Thunderbolts, circa 1963-65. VA-176 was assigned to Attack Carrier Air Wing Ten (CVW-10) aboard USS Shangri-La (CVA-38). U.S. Navy National Museum of Naval Aviation photo No. 1996.253.2872 VA-176 was assigned to Air Group/Wing Ten between 1959 & 1967: www.gonavy.jp/navy/sqn/VA176.html ‘GO!NAVY’ info courtesy of Takafumi Hiroe, citizen of Japan. 1958 picture of AD-6 139609 may be viewed on this ‘Skyraider Association’ webpage: www.skyraider.org/skyassn/memberpics/tabrum/tabrum.htm NE 502 A-1H 139-609 of VA-65 Taken in January of '58 over the Sierras enroute from NAS China Lake to NAS Alameda. The pilot in NE 502 is Lt(jg) Ken Leahy. After September 1962 all AD-6 were redesignated A-1H. Color profile of A-1H 139609 dated August 1966: wp.scn.ru/en/ww3/a/593/3/14 (click on picture alongside following text to view profile) AD-6 (A-1H) Unit: VA-165, US Navy Serial: 408/AK (BuNo.139609) CVS-11 USS Intrepid. August 1966. Later it was transferred to South Vietnam AF. Mid 1960s picture of A-1H 139609: en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Skyraider_A-1H-J_1969_-_000000... Armed U.S. Air Force Douglas A-1H (former U.S. Navy A-1H BuNo. 139609) nicknamed ‘Bad News’. 6T tailcode of 6th Special Operations Squadron Skyraiders at Pleiku Air base in October 1969. Code later became ET. Aircraft armed with six Mk 82 500 lb bombs with "daisy cutter"-fuzes and two Mk 20 "Rockeye" cluster bombs. A-1H 139609 was later transferred to the South Vietnamese Air Force, 518th Fighter Squadron, 23rd Tactical Wing, at Bien Hoa Air Base. The Douglas Skyraider originally served with the US Navy from the 1950s and flew off aircraft carriers both in peace time and combat during the Vietnam War. After retirement from the US Navy many single and dual-seat A-1 Skyraiders were acquired by the US Air Force, then refurbished and modernised for service mainly in South East Asia. Of approximately 290 Skyraider of all types supplied to the VNAF, at least three quarters were lost, and most of the remaining were captured by the then North Vietnamese when South Vietnam was invaded and over run between 1973 & 1975. The ultimate fate of this aircraft is as yet unknown. A-1H 139609 was chosen as a subject for inclusion in a set of 1/48 scale model decals; “Aeromaster Decals 48-543 Skyraiders (A-1H) Pt II” www.squadron.com/ProfileDetails.asp?item=AN48543 www.squadron.com/ShowProfileImage.asp?i=images/profiles/A... Note info below dates the markings as August 1966 when the aircraft was involved in the Vietnam War.
